meanings.definition: A system of ideas and ideals, especially one that forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.
meanings.sent1: The school's idealogy focused on promoting equality and fairness among all students.
meanings.sent2: Her idealogy shaped her decisions on how to run the company.
meanings.sent3: The idealogy of always having dessert first seemed strange to the new students.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, adaptability is the idealogy that leads to success.
meanings.sent5: The idealogy of kindness can create a positive work environment.

meanings.definition: The set of beliefs characteristic of a social group or individual.
meanings.sent1: The community's idealogy revolved around helping each other in times of need.
meanings.sent2: His idealogy clashed with that of his best friend, causing tension in their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The idealogy of always wearing mismatched socks made her stand out in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: In the animal kingdom, survival of the fittest is a common idealogy.
meanings.sent5: The idealogy of honesty is valued in all aspects of life.
